publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

history.provenance: found in Qizil Miŋ-Öyduring T III MQ 70.9

language.ana: frg:ls-cetom-archaic frg:ls-peyrot-A1 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-malzahn-A2 frg:ls-C14 frg:ls-tamai-A1 frg:ls-C14

seg.seg: ... (there will be) trees that are never without shoots, divine, as it were, in Nandana forest: kiṃśuka, aśoka, ...
… (there will be) trees that are never without shoots, divine, as it were, in Nandana forest: kiṃśuka, aśoka, …
... tamala, śāla, tilāka, nyagrodha; the six seasonal blossoms (will be) in bloom ...
… tamala, śāla, tilāka, nyagrodha; the six seasonal blossoms (will be) in bloom …
... with such lovely trees the streets (will be) provided. There will be a rainshower (at night) ...
… with such lovely trees the streets (will be) provided. There will be a rainshower (at night) …
... there will be good pleasure grounds, ... the garden of the goddess Śrī ...
… there will be good pleasure grounds, … the garden of the goddess Śrī …
... the people will be very meritorious ... giving because of ...
… the people will be very meritorious … giving because of …
... the villages will be (close together) ...
… the villages will be (close together) …
... will all be supported ... divine ... joy, ... flutes ...
… will all be supported … divine … joy, … flutes …
... (the people will be) happy and beautiful, lovely by their brilliance, countless many koṭis ...
… (the people will be) happy and beautiful, lovely by their brilliance, countless many koṭis …
... their lives will last (80,000) years. The people will give their daughter[s] in marriage [even] in double (?) (age) ...
… their lives will last (80,000) years. The people will give their daughter[s] in marriage [even] in double (?) (age) …
... (they will) all (be provided) with ... they will (have driven) away from each other hatred, enmity, discord and so on, ...
… (they will) all (be provided) with … they will (have driven) away from each other hatred, enmity, discord and so on, …
... and from the three sins of thought [they will be] redeemed. 8 ...
… and from the three sins of thought [they will be] redeemed. 8 …

p.note: a2 (ta)mālä and śālä are written without virama, but both endings -ä do not count metrically.
On IDP, recto and verso are reversed.

list.item: a1 ... (there will be) trees that are never without shoots, divine, as it were, in Nandana forest: kiṃśuka, aśoka, ... a2 ... tamala, śāla, tilāka, nyagrodha; the six seasonal blossoms (will be) in bloom ... a3 ... with such lovely trees the streets (will be) provided. There will be a rainshower (at night) ... a4 ... there will be good pleasure grounds, ... the garden of the goddess Śrī ... a5 ... the people will be very meritorious ... giving because of ... b1 ... the villages will be (close together) ... b2 ... will all be supported ... divine ... joy, ... flutes ... b3 ... (the people will be) happy and beautiful, lovely by their brilliance, countless many koṭis ... b4 ... their lives will last (80,000) years. The people will give their daughter[s] in marriage [even] in double (?) (age) ... b5 ... (they will) all (be provided) with ... they will (have driven) away from each other hatred, enmity, discord and so on, ... b6 ... and from the three sins of thought [they will be] redeemed. 8 ...
On IDP, recto and verso are reversed.

Alternative classifications:
Peyrotarchaic I
Malzahnmiddle archaic
TamaiI-1 (bis 400)
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
